definition: to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]
to encircle/to surround/all around/to wear by wrapping around (scarf, shawl)

sentences.english: We have our enemy almost surrounded.
sentences.chinese: 我们差不多把敌人包围起来了。

sentences.english: I was surrounded by sky-blue silk and polished lacquer .
sentences.chinese: 我被天蓝色的绸子和光亮的漆器包围着。

sentences.english: A rubber tube encloses each one.
Duration October, yang Dezhi leads a ministry to approach Xu Shui, carry out to Xu Shui surround.
sentences.chinese: 时值十月，杨德志率部逼近徐水，对徐水实施包围。

sentences.english: This is a terrorist siege of India.
sentences.chinese: 这是印度面临的恐怖包围。

sentences.english: Embracing by glamorous light, the meteor is under the wings of Cupid.
sentences.chinese: 被一群光芒所包围的流星，是被爱神翅膀所保护的。

sentences.english: After the game, Mussina jumbled numbers as media engulfed him.
sentences.chinese: 赛后，当媒体包围著他老穆谈到随机变数。

sentences.english: The corn fields and meadows were surrounded by large forests, in the midst of which were deep pools.
sentences.chinese: 稻田和草地被大森林包围，森林中央有深的池塘水淀。

sentences.english: In fact, the city proper itself is one that is surrounded or covered by grapevines.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，城市本身是一个包围或覆盖葡萄。

sentences.english: After also sent from encirclement of the shaolin temple.
sentences.chinese: 之后还派了兵马包围住少林寺。

sentences.english: The team found that the key appears to be joints in the bony vertebrae that wrap protectively around the spinal cord.
sentences.chinese: 这个团队发现起关键作用的是包围脊索的脊椎骨关节。

sentences.english: In Oates' works, females are always played with by violence.
sentences.chinese: 在欧茨笔下，女性始终处于暴力的包围与摆弄中。

sentences.english: After a prolonged siege, the town was rendered up to the insurgents.
sentences.chinese: 经过长时间包围之后，这个小镇已被起义军攻克。

sentences.english: Completely surrounded by our soldiers , the enemy finally gave in.
sentences.chinese: 在我军士兵得彻底包围下，敌人终于弃械投降。
敌人包围了他们的堡垒。

definition: to besiege/to beleaguer/to attack from all sides/to jointly speak or write against sb
to surround/to close in around (one's enemy, prey etc)
pincer attack/attack from two or more sides/converging attack/attack on a flank/fork in chess, with one piece making two attacks
to encircle/to surround/all around/to wear by wrapping around (scarf, shawl)
to encircle and annihilate/refers to repeated campaigns of the Guomindang against the communists from 1930 onwards
to annihilate/to wipe out completely/to exterminate
to stop/to obstruct/to bar the way
